items.title: Fluent System Icons
items.snippet: A collection of familiar, friendly, and modern icons from Microsoft, designed to enhance user interfaces with a consistent and recognizable visual language.

items.title: Anthropic Cookbook
items.snippet: A collection of notebooks and recipes showcasing effective ways to utilize Claude, an AI language model developed by Anthropic, for various applications.

items.title: Prompt Engineering Interactive Tutorial
items.snippet: An interactive tutorial by Anthropic designed to teach the principles and techniques of prompt engineering for AI language models.

items.title: Awesome LLM Apps
items.snippet: A curated list of impressive applications built using Large Language Models (LLMs), featuring AI agents and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) techniques.

items.title: Immich
items.snippet: A high-performance, self-hosted photo and video management solution that offers features like automatic backups, sharing, and organization of media files.

items.title: LeRobot
items.snippet: A project by Hugging Face aimed at making AI for robotics more accessible through end-to-end learning solutions, facilitating the development of intelligent robotic systems.

items.title: File Browser
items.snippet: A web-based file browser that allows users to manage and organize their files through a simple and intuitive interface, supporting various file operations.

items.title: Desktop
items.snippet: A project focused on creating a calmer internet experience by developing a browser that minimizes distractions and promotes focused browsing.

items.title: Tech giants ramp up spending as AI starts to deliver
items.snippet: Microsoft, Google, and Meta are significantly increasing investments in data centers and computing infrastructure as AI begins to generate real revenue. Despite strong earnings, these companies are reinvesting heavily in AI infrastructure, signaling their belief that the AI boom is still in its early stages.

items.title: Scientists create glowing artificial cells that pulse to 24-hour biological clock
items.snippet: Artificial cells built at UC Merced pulse with a perfect 24-hour rhythm, just like the real thing.

queries: AI advancements latest news past 48 hours
AI advancements announcement OR launch OR unveils past 3 days
AI advancements breakthrough OR benchmark OR SOTA past week
AI advancements report OR analysis OR deep dive past week
AI advancements GitHub release OR repo trending past week

decision.reason: Current preview is a single Axios piece and outside the requested 48-hour window; need fresher, corroborated signals to judge novelty and credibility.
next_focus: Earnings/transcripts in last 48h mentioning concrete AI deployment metrics (cost per inference, throughput gains, unit economics) from Nvidia, Microsoft, Google, Amazon
Peerâ€‘reviewed or preprint breakthroughs posted in last 48h (arXiv, Nature, Science) with reproducible code/data for model efficiency, alignment, or multimodal capabilities
Regulatory or standards moves in last 48h (EU, US, China) that materially change AI deployment or safety requirements

queries: technical innovations latest news past 48 hours
technical innovations announcement OR launch OR unveils past 3 days
technical innovations breakthrough OR benchmark OR SOTA past week
technical innovations report OR analysis OR deep dive past week
technical innovations GitHub release OR repo trending past week

decision.reason: Preview shows several promising items but sources are a single outlet and lack cross-verification or primary references; need to validate novelty/impact and filter hype.
next_focus: site:arxiv.org OR site:nature.com OR site:science.org OR site:ieee.org validation of each headline topic within last 7 days (e.g., tandem perovskite 34.6% Longi efficiency, terahertz control of 2D semiconductors, energy-harvesting glass)
press releases or lab pages for originating institutions/companies (e.g., LONGi, university labs on circadian artificial cells, VR haptic glove manufacturer) within 48 hours
independent coverage from reputable tech/science outlets (MIT Technology Review, IEEE Spectrum, Nature News, Science News) to assess novelty and claims
